publication.title: Characterization of metagenome-assembled genomes from the International Space Station

results.magnitude: 46 MAGs assembled from 21 ISS environmental metagenomes

results.effect: 18 bacterial species identified, including one novel genus/species combination (Kalamiella piersonii) and one novel bacterial species (Methylobacterium ajmalii)
4 bins exhibited fungal genomes; this is the first-time fungal genomes were assembled from ISS metagenomes.
results.magnitude: first-time fungal genome assembly from ISS metagenomes

results.effect: Phylogenetic analyses of five bacterial species showed ISS-specific evolution.
Genes pertaining to cell membranes, such as transmembrane transport, cell wall organization, and regulation of cell shape, were enriched.
results.magnitude: enrichment of genes related to cell membranes

results.effect: Variations in the AMR and virulence genes of the selected 20 MAGs were characterized to predict the ecology and evolution of biosafety level (BSL) 2 microorganisms in space.
results.magnitude: characterization of AMR and virulence genes

results.effect: MAGs were further used to analyze if genes involved in AMR and biofilm formation of viable microbes in ISS have variation due to generational evolution in microgravity and radiation pressure.
results.magnitude: variation of AMR and biofilm genes in space
